message.content:
cs.SE, cs.CY, cs.DL, cs.HC, cs.SI. 

The paper discusses the challenges of coordinating and communicating knowledge and expertise in large-scale scientific software projects, which is a key aspect of software engineering (cs.SE). The case study focuses on the Trilinos project, which is a computational science and engineering software library (cs.CY). The paper also discusses the need for better practices and tools to address the challenges of scaling up software production, which could fall under the category of digital libraries (cs.DL). The recommendations provided in the paper also touch on human-computer interaction (cs.HC) and social computing (cs.SI) as ways to improve communication and collaboration among developers.
